comment.author: 66311327@N05
comment._content: "Radomir Putnik, also known as Vojvoda Putnik, (Serbian: Радомир Путник, Војвода Путник; pronounced [rǎdɔmiːr pûːtniːk]; 24 January 1847 – 17 May 1917) was a first Serbian Vojvoda i.e Field Marshal and Chief of the General Staff of the Serbian army in the Balkan Wars and in the First World War. He took part in all of the wars that Serbia waged from 1876 to 1917." en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Radomir_Putnik

comment.author: 35014516@N03
comment._content: B-59:  Thanks for providing us with more complete information on Putnik.  We'll include some next time we update.
